short: If you presume something, it means you act as though it's true before all the evidence is in. If you are presumed to be the fastest runner, don't get too cocky ā that word implies that you haven't actually raced yet.
long: To presume is to take something for granted. The famous quote āDr. Livingstone, I presume?ā comes from the explorer Henry Morton Stanley, who ran into the explorer David Livingstone in the wilds of Africa in 1871. Itās funny because these were the only two white men known to be in that part of Africa at the time.
